foods.name: Pizza Margherita
foods.description: Classic Italian pizza with tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil.
foods.instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F. Spread tomato sauce over rolled out pizza dough, add sliced mozzarella and basil. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 10-15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.

foods.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
foods.description: Creamy Italian pasta dish with egg, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.
foods.instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente. In a bowl, whisk eggs and grated parmesan. Fry pancetta until crisp. Toss spaghetti with pancetta, remove from heat, then quickly stir in egg mixture to create a creamy sauce. Season with pepper and serve immediately.

foods.name: Lasagna
foods.description: Baked Italian pasta casserole layered with meat sauce, cheese, and béchamel.
foods.instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cook lasagna noodles. Prepare meat sauce by sautéing onion and garlic, adding ground beef, and stirring in tomato sauce. In a baking dish, layer noodles, meat sauce, ricotta, and mozzarella. Repeat layers and top with parmesan. Bake for about 45 minutes until bubbly.

foods.name: Risotto alla Milanese
foods.description: Creamy Italian rice dish flavored with saffron and parmesan.
foods.instructions: Heat chicken broth. Sauté onion in butter until translucent. Add arborio rice and toast briefly. Stir in white wine until absorbed. Add saffron and ladle broth gradually, stirring, until rice is al dente and creamy. Stir in parmesan and serve warm.

foods.name: Caprese Salad
foods.description: Simple Italian salad with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil.
foods.instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella. Arrange alternating slices on a plate, tucking basil leaves between. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic, then season with salt and pepper.

foods.name: Tiramisu
foods.description: Classic Italian dessert made with coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream.
foods.instructions: Brew espresso and cool. Beat egg yolks with sugar, then mix in mascarpone to form a cream. Dip ladyfingers into espresso (with coffee liqueur if using) and layer in a dish. Spread half the mascarpone cream over them, then add another layer of dipped ladyfingers and top with remaining cream. Refrigerate for several hours, then dust with cocoa powder before serving.

foods.name: Minestrone Soup
foods.description: Italian hearty vegetable soup with pasta and beans.
foods.instructions: Sauté onions, carrots, celery and zucchini in olive oil until softened. Add tomatoes and broth, bring to a boil. Stir in pasta and beans, simmer until pasta is al dente. Season with salt, pepper, and parsley. Serve hot.

foods.name: Bruschetta
foods.description: Italian appetizer of grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with tomato mixture.
foods.instructions: Slice bread and grill or toast until golden. Rub each slice with garlic. In a bowl, mix chopped tomatoes, basil, olive oil, salt and pepper. Spoon tomato mixture onto the bread slices and serve immediately.

foods.name: Gnocchi with Pesto
foods.description: Potato gnocchi tossed in vibrant basil pesto sauce.
foods.instructions: Boil potatoes and mash. Mix with flour and egg to form dough; roll into ropes and cut into pieces. Boil gnocchi until they float. Blend basil, garlic, pine nuts, parmesan and olive oil to make pesto. Toss cooked gnocchi with pesto and serve.

foods.name: Focaccia Bread
foods.description: Italian flatbread topped with herbs and olive oil.
foods.instructions: Combine flour, yeast, water and a bit of olive oil to make dough. Let rise until doubled. Spread dough onto a baking sheet, dimple the surface, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with rosemary and salt. Bake at 425°F for 20 minutes until golden brown.

foods.name: Tacos al Pastor
foods.description: Mexican street tacos with marinated pork and pineapple.
foods.instructions: Marinate thin pork slices in achiote paste and citrus juice, then grill or roast. Chop pork and mix with diced pineapple. Serve on warmed corn tortillas with chopped onion, cilantro and a squeeze of lime.

foods.name: Chicken Enchiladas
foods.description: Corn tortillas filled with chicken and cheese, topped with enchilada sauce.
foods.instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Fill tortillas with shredded chicken and some cheese, roll up, and place in a baking dish. Pour enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with more cheese. Bake until hot and bubbly, then garnish with cilantro.

foods.name: Guacamole
foods.description: Creamy Mexican avocado dip with lime and cilantro.
foods.instructions: Mash ripe avocados in a bowl. Mix in chopped red onion, cilantro, diced jalapeño and lime juice. Season with salt. Serve immediately with tortilla chips.

foods.name: Quesadilla
foods.description: Grilled tortilla filled with melted cheese and optional fillings.
foods.instructions: Heat a skillet and place a tortilla on it. Add shredded cheese and desired fillings like cooked chicken and peppers. Top with another tortilla. Cook until golden on both sides and cheese is melted. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa.

foods.name: Chiles Rellenos
foods.description: Roasted poblano peppers stuffed with cheese, battered and fried.
foods.instructions: Roast peppers and peel skins. Make a slit and remove seeds. Stuff with queso fresco. Dip each pepper in flour, then beaten egg, and fry until golden. Serve with warm tomato sauce drizzled on top.

foods.name: Mole Poblano
foods.description: Rich Mexican sauce with chili, chocolate, and spices, served over chicken.
foods.instructions: Toast chilies, nuts and spices. Blend with tomatoes, chocolate and broth to make a thick sauce. Simmer chicken in the mole sauce until cooked through. Serve hot with a sprinkle of sesame seeds.

foods.name: Churros
foods.description: Fried dough pastry sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon.
foods.instructions: Bring water and butter to boil, then stir in flour to form dough. Let it cool slightly and beat in eggs. Pipe dough into hot oil and fry until golden. Roll fried churros in cinnamon-sugar mixture.

foods.name: Tamales
foods.description: Steamed masa dough stuffed with seasoned meat filling.
foods.instructions: Soak corn husks. Prepare masa dough with masa harina and fat. Season shredded meat with tomato and chili. Spread masa on husks, add filling, fold and tie. Steam tamales for about 1 hour until firm.

foods.name: Pico de Gallo
foods.description: Fresh Mexican salsa made with chopped tomatoes, onion, and cilantro.
foods.instructions: Chop tomatoes, onion, cilantro, and jalapeño finely. Mix together in a bowl and squeeze fresh lime juice over it. Season with salt and stir to combine. Serve fresh.

foods.name: Horchata
foods.description: Refreshing Mexican rice milk drink flavored with cinnamon.
foods.instructions: Soak rice in water with cinnamon overnight, then blend until smooth. Strain the mixture and mix with almond milk, sugar, and vanilla. Serve chilled over ice.

foods.name: Butter Chicken
foods.description: Creamy tomato-based curry with tender chicken pieces.
foods.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices, then sauté. Make a sauce with butter, tomato puree, garlic, ginger and spices. Add chicken to the sauce and simmer until cooked. Stir in cream before serving.

foods.name: Vegetable Biryani
foods.description: Fragrant rice dish cooked with mixed vegetables and spices.
foods.instructions: Parboil basmati rice with spices and set aside. Sauté vegetables with onions, ginger, and spices. Layer rice and vegetables in a pot, pour saffron-infused milk on top. Cover and cook on low until rice is fluffy.

foods.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
foods.description: Grilled chicken chunks in a creamy spiced tomato sauce.
foods.instructions: Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt and spices, then grill or broil. For the sauce, sauté garlic and spices, add tomato sauce and cream to simmer. Stir in cooked chicken and heat through. Garnish with cilantro.

foods.name: Samosa
foods.description: Fried pastry pockets filled with spiced potatoes and peas.
foods.instructions: Boil and mash potatoes. Sauté onion, peas, and spices, then mix with potatoes. Wrap filling in thin dough sheets to make triangles. Deep fry the samosas until golden brown and crispy.

foods.name: Palak Paneer
foods.description: Indian curry with spinach (palak) and paneer cheese.
foods.instructions: Blanch spinach and puree. Fry onions, garlic and ginger, then add tomato and spices. Add pureed spinach and paneer cubes to simmer. Stir in a bit of cream and serve hot.

foods.name: Dal Tadka
foods.description: Yellow lentils tempered with spices and garlic.
foods.instructions: Cook lentils with turmeric until soft. In a pan, heat ghee and sauté cumin, mustard seeds, garlic and chilies. Pour this seasoning (tadka) over the cooked dal with chopped tomatoes. Simmer for a few minutes and garnish with cilantro.

foods.name: Naan
foods.description: Leavened Indian flatbread, baked in a tandoor or oven.
foods.instructions: Mix flour, yeast, yogurt, salt and water to form dough. Let it rise. Roll out dough into flat rounds, brush with oil or garlic butter. Bake at high heat or cook on a skillet until puffy and golden.

foods.name: Gulab Jamun
foods.description: Sweet Indian dessert of fried dough balls soaked in syrup.
foods.instructions: Mix milk powder, flour, ghee and water to form a dough. Roll into small balls. Fry in ghee or oil until golden. In the meantime, prepare sugar syrup with water, sugar and cardamom. Soak the fried dough balls in warm syrup.

foods.name: Masala Chai
foods.description: Spiced Indian tea with milk and aromatic spices.
foods.instructions: Boil water with crushed ginger, cardamom and cinnamon. Add tea leaves and simmer briefly. Pour in milk and bring to a gentle boil. Strain and sweeten with sugar as desired.

foods.name: Aloo Gobi
foods.description: Dry curry of potatoes and cauliflower with turmeric and spices.
foods.instructions: Sauté cumin and garlic in oil. Add diced potatoes, cauliflower florets, turmeric and other spices. Cook until vegetables begin to soften. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until done. Garnish with cilantro.

foods.name: Pad Thai
foods.description: Stir-fried rice noodle dish with shrimp, tofu, peanuts, and bean sprouts.
foods.instructions: Soak rice noodles until pliable. Stir-fry garlic, shrimp and tofu. Push to side and scramble eggs. Mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, and a bit of sugar into a sauce. Add noodles and sauce to the pan, toss with bean sprouts. Serve topped with chopped peanuts and lime wedges.

foods.name: Green Curry
foods.description: Thai curry with coconut milk, green curry paste, and vegetables or meat.
foods.instructions: Heat green curry paste in a pot, add chicken and stir until coated. Pour in coconut milk and simmer. Add bamboo shoots, eggplant, and other veggies, cooking until tender. Season with fish sauce. Serve garnished with basil leaves and jasmine rice.

foods.name: Tom Yum Soup
foods.description: Hot and sour Thai soup with shrimp, lemongrass, and mushrooms.
foods.instructions: Boil water with sliced lemongrass and galangal. Add shrimp and mushrooms, cooking until shrimp turns pink. Season with fish sauce and lime juice, and add chopped chilies. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve hot.

foods.name: Mango Sticky Rice
foods.description: Sweet Thai dessert of sticky rice with coconut milk and mango.
foods.instructions: Soak glutinous rice, then steam until cooked. Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt. Pour most of the coconut milk over cooked rice and let it absorb. Serve sticky rice topped with slices of fresh mango and a drizzle of remaining coconut milk.

foods.name: Som Tam
foods.description: Thai green papaya salad with lime, chili, and peanuts.
foods.instructions: Pound garlic and chilies in a mortar. Add shredded papaya, chopped tomatoes, and long beans. Crush lightly with a pestle, then squeeze in lime juice, fish sauce, and a little sugar. Toss in roasted peanuts and serve.

foods.name: Cheeseburger
foods.description: Classic American grilled beef burger with cheese, lettuce, and tomato.
foods.instructions: Grill the beef patty to desired doneness. Toast the bun halves. Place the patty on the bun, top with cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, ketchup and mustard. Serve with pickles and fries.

foods.name: BBQ Ribs
foods.description: Slow-cooked pork ribs slathered in barbecue sauce.
foods.instructions: Rub ribs with brown sugar and spices. Slow-cook or bake covered with foil at 300°F for 2-3 hours until tender. Uncover, brush generously with barbecue sauce, and bake for 15 more minutes. Slice and serve with extra sauce.

foods.name: Mac and Cheese
foods.description: Creamy American comfort food with macaroni pasta and cheese sauce.
foods.instructions: Cook macaroni until al dente. Make a roux with butter and flour, then whisk in milk to make sauce. Stir in shredded cheese to melt. Combine sauce with drained macaroni in a baking dish, top with breadcrumbs, and bake until bubbly.

foods.name: Caesar Salad
foods.description: Salad of romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing, croutons, and parmesan.
foods.instructions: Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, crushed garlic, anchovies, and egg to make dressing. Toss chopped lettuce with dressing, croutons and shaved parmesan. Serve immediately.

foods.name: Apple Pie
foods.description: Classic American dessert of spiced apple filling in a flaky crust.
foods.instructions: Peel and slice apples, then toss with sugar, lemon juice, and cinnamon. Fill a pastry-lined pie dish with the apples, dot with butter, and cover with top crust. Bake at 375°F until crust is golden and filling is bubbly.

foods.name: Clam Chowder
foods.description: Creamy soup with clams, potatoes, and bacon.
foods.instructions: Cook bacon until crisp, then sauté onions and celery in the rendered fat. Stir in flour to form a roux, gradually add clam juice and cream. Add diced potatoes and clams and simmer until potatoes are tender. Serve garnished with parsley.

foods.name: Pancakes
foods.description: Fluffy American breakfast pancakes served with maple syrup.
foods.instructions: Mix flour, baking powder, salt, milk, egg, and melted butter to form batter. Pour batter onto a hot griddle or pan, cooking until bubbles form, then flip to cook the other side. Stack pancakes and serve with butter and syrup.

foods.name: Buffalo Wings
foods.description: Spicy deep-fried chicken wings tossed in buffalo sauce.
foods.instructions: Deep-fry chicken wings until crispy. In a saucepan, melt butter and mix with hot sauce and spices. Toss the wings in the buffalo sauce. Serve hot with celery sticks and blue cheese dip.

foods.name: Cobb Salad
foods.description: Hearty American salad with chicken, bacon, egg, and blue cheese.
foods.instructions: Grill chicken and cook bacon, then chop. On a platter, arrange lettuce, sliced chicken, bacon, quartered eggs, chopped tomatoes, avocado slices and crumbled blue cheese. Drizzle with vinaigrette and toss before serving.

foods.name: Cornbread
foods.description: Southern baked bread made from cornmeal.
foods.instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Mix cornmeal, flour, baking powder, milk, egg, and melted butter into a batter. Pour into a greased pan and bake until golden brown. Serve warm with butter.

foods.name: Kung Pao Chicken
foods.description: Spicy stir-fried Chinese dish with chicken, peanuts, and chili peppers.
foods.instructions: Marinate chicken in soy sauce and cornstarch. Stir-fry garlic, ginger, and chilies, add chicken until cooked. Stir in soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and peanuts, cooking until sauce thickens. Garnish with scallions.

foods.name: Sweet and Sour Pork
foods.description: Chinese dish with battered pork and sweet-sour sauce with pineapple.
foods.instructions: Cut pork into pieces, coat in cornstarch and fry until golden. Stir-fry bell peppers and pineapple. Mix vinegar, ketchup, and sugar for sauce. Combine pork with vegetables and sauce in the pan and simmer until sauce thickens.

foods.name: Fried Rice
foods.description: Stir-fried rice with eggs, vegetables, and choice of meat or shrimp.
foods.instructions: Use leftover cooked rice. Stir-fry vegetables and shrimp, push to one side, scramble eggs on other side. Mix rice with everything, add soy sauce, and stir-fry until well combined. Top with chopped scallions.

foods.name: Dim Sum
foods.description: Assorted Chinese bite-sized steamed dumplings and buns, often in bamboo baskets.
foods.instructions: Prepare various fillings like shrimp and pork. Wrap fillings in dumpling or bun dough. Steam the dumplings and buns in bamboo baskets until cooked. Serve with soy sauce and vinegar dipping sauce.

foods.name: Spring Rolls
foods.description: Crispy Chinese appetizer rolls filled with vegetables or meat.
foods.instructions: Sauté chopped cabbage, carrot, mushrooms, garlic, and ginger in oil until soft. Season with soy sauce. Wrap the filling in spring roll wrappers and seal with a flour-water paste. Deep fry until golden.

foods.name: Peking Duck
foods.description: Crispy roasted duck served with pancakes and hoisin sauce.
foods.instructions: Glaze duck with honey and soy sauce, then roast at high heat until skin is crispy. Carve the duck and serve slices on thin pancakes with hoisin sauce, scallions, and cucumber strips.

foods.name: Dumplings
foods.description: Steamed or fried dough pockets filled with meat or vegetables.
foods.instructions: Mix ground pork with chopped cabbage, ginger, soy sauce and sesame oil for filling. Place a spoonful in the center of a wrapper, fold and seal. Steam or pan-fry the dumplings until cooked through. Serve with dipping sauce.

foods.name: Mapo Tofu
foods.description: Spicy Sichuan dish of tofu in chili bean paste sauce with pork.
foods.instructions: Sauté garlic, ginger, and ground pork. Stir in doubanjiang and a bit of broth, add cubed tofu gently. Simmer to absorb flavors. Garnish with scallions and a drizzle of sesame oil.

foods.name: Hot and Sour Soup
foods.description: Chinese soup with mushrooms, tofu, and a tangy hot-sour flavor.
foods.instructions: Bring broth to a boil. Add sliced mushrooms, bamboo shoots and cubed tofu. Season with soy sauce, vinegar, and white pepper. Slowly stir in beaten egg to create silky strands. Serve hot.

foods.name: Chow Mein
foods.description: Chinese stir-fried noodles with vegetables and meat or tofu.
foods.instructions: Cook egg noodles and set aside. Stir-fry vegetables and protein. Add noodles back to pan, pour in soy sauce and toss everything together until heated through. Serve immediately.

foods.name: Falafel
foods.description: Deep-fried balls made from ground chickpeas and herbs.
foods.instructions: Soak and blend chickpeas with parsley, onion, garlic, cumin, and coriander until coarse. Form mixture into balls or patties. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy. Serve with tahini sauce or in pita.

foods.name: Hummus
foods.description: Creamy dip made from blended chickpeas, tahini, and lemon.
foods.instructions: Blend cooked chickpeas with tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and salt until smooth. Drizzle in olive oil while blending for creaminess. Transfer to a bowl and sprinkle with paprika before serving.

foods.name: Chicken Shawarma
foods.description: Middle Eastern spiced grilled chicken, often served in pita.
foods.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice and spices, then grill or roast until cooked through. Slice thinly and serve in pita bread with vegetables and tahini or garlic sauce.

foods.name: Tabbouleh
foods.description: Lebanese salad of parsley, bulgur, tomatoes, and mint.
foods.instructions: Soak bulgur in water until tender. Chop parsley, tomatoes, mint, and onion finely. Toss together with drained bulgur, lemon juice, olive oil, and salt.

foods.name: Baklava
foods.description: Sweet pastry layers with nuts and honey syrup.
foods.instructions: Layer sheets of phyllo in a pan, brushing each with butter. Sprinkle chopped walnuts and cinnamon between layers. After baking until golden, pour sugar and honey syrup over it. Let it soak before cutting.

foods.name: Baba Ganoush
foods.description: Smoky Middle Eastern dip made from roasted eggplant.
foods.instructions: Roast or grill eggplants until skins char. Scoop out flesh and blend with tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with parsley.

foods.name: Kibbeh
foods.description: Fried Middle Eastern croquette made with bulgur and spiced meat.
foods.instructions: Soak bulgur and mix with ground beef and spices to form a dough. Make a stuffing of cooked beef, onions and pine nuts. Form shells from dough, fill with stuffing, and shape into ovals. Fry until golden brown.

foods.name: Fattoush
foods.description: Levantine salad with toasted pita and fresh vegetables.
foods.instructions: Chop lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, and mint. Tear toasted pita into pieces. Mix olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper to make dressing. Toss vegetables and pita with dressing.

foods.name: Shakshuka
foods.description: Eggs poached in a spicy tomato and pepper sauce.
foods.instructions: Sauté onions and bell peppers, then add garlic and spices. Pour in chopped tomatoes and simmer until thick. Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them. Cover and cook until eggs set.

foods.name: Turkish Coffee
foods.description: Strong, unfiltered coffee from Turkey.
foods.instructions: Combine water, finely ground coffee, and cardamom in a cezve or small pot. Heat slowly until it begins to froth (do not boil over). Pour coffee into cups without filtering, letting grounds settle.

foods.name: Jollof Rice
foods.description: Spicy West African rice dish cooked in tomato stew.
foods.instructions: Sauté onions and peppers in oil, then add tomato sauce and spices to make a stew. Stir in rice and broth, cover, and simmer until rice is cooked and absorbs the flavors. Serve hot.

foods.name: Couscous with Vegetables
foods.description: North African steamed semolina with stewed vegetables.
foods.instructions: Steam couscous with a bit of oil or butter. Sauté garlic and vegetables, add tomato paste and spices, and simmer to make a stew. Pour the vegetable stew over couscous and fluff together before serving.

foods.name: Injera and Doro Wat
foods.description: Ethiopian flatbread with spicy chicken stew.
foods.instructions: Prepare injera batter and let ferment, then pour thin batter onto a griddle to make spongy flatbread. For doro wat, cook onions slowly until caramelized, add berbere and garlic, then chicken and simmer with niter kibbeh until thick and rich. Serve stew on top of injera.

foods.name: Bunny Chow
foods.description: South African hollowed-out bread filled with curry.
foods.instructions: Hollow out a quarter loaf of bread. Cook a spicy curry with onions, tomatoes and chosen meat. Fill the bread shell with hot curry. Serve as a hearty sandwich.

foods.name: Bobotie
foods.description: South African baked dish of spiced minced meat with egg topping.
foods.instructions: Soak bread in milk. Sauté onions and curry, add ground beef and raisins, and cook together. Press mixture into a baking dish, pour beaten eggs and milk on top. Bake until set and golden.

foods.name: Egusi Soup
foods.description: Nigerian stew made with ground melon seeds and vegetables.
foods.instructions: Blend egusi seeds into a paste. Sauté onions and palm oil, add blended egusi and stir to cook. Add meat, fish, and stock to simmer. Stir in chopped greens and cook until oil separates and soup thickens. Serve with fufu or rice.

foods.name: Moroccan Lamb Tagine
foods.description: Slow-cooked Moroccan stew with lamb, spices, and dried fruits.
foods.instructions: Brown lamb pieces, then cook with onions and spices. Add dried apricots, almonds, and preserved lemon. Slow-cook or bake in a tagine pot until lamb is tender and sauce is thick. Serve with couscous.

foods.name: Puff-Puff
foods.description: West African sweet deep-fried dough balls.
foods.instructions: Mix flour, yeast, sugar, salt and water to make a batter. Let it rise until bubbly. Drop spoonfuls of batter into hot oil and fry until golden brown. Drain and serve warm, dusted with sugar.

foods.name: Mandazi
foods.description: East African sweet fried dough, similar to a donut.
foods.instructions: Combine flour, coconut milk, yeast, sugar, and cardamom to make dough. Let it rise. Roll out and cut into triangles or shapes. Fry in hot oil until lightly browned on both sides. Serve plain or with jam.

foods.name: Ugali and Sukuma Wiki
foods.description: Kenyan staple of maize porridge (ugali) with sautéed collard greens (sukuma wiki).
foods.instructions: Boil water and slowly stir in maize meal until thick to make ugali. For sukuma wiki, sauté onions and tomatoes, add chopped collard greens and cook until tender. Serve the collard greens alongside a mound of ugali.

foods.name: Sushi Rolls
foods.description: Japanese vinegared rice rolled with fish or vegetables in seaweed.
foods.instructions: Cook sushi rice and season with vinegar. Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat, spread rice, and arrange fillings like fish or veggies. Roll tightly and slice into pieces. Serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

foods.name: Tonkotsu Ramen
foods.description: Japanese noodle soup with rich pork bone broth.
foods.instructions: Simmer pork bones for hours to make a milky broth. Cook ramen noodles separately. Slice pork belly and soft-boil eggs. Assemble noodles in a bowl, pour hot broth over, and top with pork, egg, green onions, and nori.

foods.name: Tempura
foods.description: Assorted seafood and vegetables battered and deep-fried.
foods.instructions: Make tempura batter with flour and ice-cold water. Dip shrimp and sliced vegetables in batter, then fry in hot oil until golden and crisp. Drain excess oil and serve with dipping sauce.

foods.name: Miso Soup
foods.description: Japanese soup made from fermented soybean paste.
foods.instructions: Heat dashi broth and stir in miso paste. Add cubed tofu and wakame seaweed. Warm through but do not boil. Serve garnished with sliced green onions.

foods.name: Yakitori
foods.description: Japanese skewered grilled chicken, often glazed with tare sauce.
foods.instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and thread onto skewers, alternating with onion pieces. Grill or broil while brushing with a sauce made of soy, sake, mirin, and sugar. Cook until glazed and juicy.

foods.name: Udon Noodle Stir-Fry
foods.description: Thick Japanese noodles stir-fried with vegetables.
foods.instructions: Cook udon noodles and set aside. Stir-fry vegetables in sesame oil, add noodles back and pour soy sauce and mirin. Toss until noodles are coated and flavors meld.

foods.name: Japanese Curry Rice
foods.description: Mild Japanese curry with vegetables served over rice.
foods.instructions: Brown chicken pieces, then sauté onions, carrots, and potatoes. Add water and curry roux cubes, simmer until vegetables are tender and curry thickens. Serve over steamed rice.

foods.name: Onigiri
foods.description: Japanese rice balls typically wrapped in seaweed with fillings.
foods.instructions: Cook sushi rice and season lightly with salt. Shape rice into triangular or cylindrical forms around a filling like pickled plum. Wrap the ball with a strip of nori.

foods.name: Matcha Tea
foods.description: Japanese green tea powder whisked into hot water.
foods.instructions: Sift matcha powder into a bowl. Pour hot water (not boiling) and whisk until frothy. Serve immediately.

foods.name: Mochi Ice Cream
foods.description: Sweet ice cream wrapped in a sticky rice cake shell.
foods.instructions: Mix rice flour, water, and sugar into a dough and microwave until thick. Let cool. Dust mochi dough, flatten, and wrap around a scoop of ice cream. Freeze until firm before serving.

foods.name: Greek Salad
foods.description: Mediterranean salad with tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese, and olives.
foods.instructions: Chop tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion. Mix in a bowl with olives. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano. Top with crumbled feta cheese and serve chilled.

foods.name: Paella
foods.description: Spanish saffron rice dish with seafood, chicken, and vegetables.
foods.instructions: Sauté onion, garlic, and peppers in olive oil. Add rice and toast lightly, then pour in broth with saffron. Arrange chicken, shrimp, and peas on top. Cover and simmer without stirring until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.

foods.name: Ratatouille
foods.description: French stewed vegetables including eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes.
foods.instructions: Slice all vegetables. Sauté onions and garlic, then layer sliced eggplant, zucchini, peppers, and tomatoes in a pot. Season with salt and herbs, then simmer on low heat until tender. Serve warm or at room temperature.

foods.name: Greek Moussaka
foods.description: Baked Mediterranean dish with layers of eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel.
foods.instructions: Slice and fry eggplant and potatoes. Sauté onion and garlic, add meat and tomato sauce to make filling. Layer potatoes, eggplant, and meat sauce in a baking dish. Pour béchamel sauce made with butter, flour, and milk on top. Bake until golden.

foods.name: Gelato
foods.description: Italian-style ice cream with a dense, creamy texture.
foods.instructions: Heat milk and cream with sugar until warm. Temper egg yolks with a bit of warm milk, then combine with the rest. Cook on low heat while stirring until slightly thickened. Cool mixture, add flavoring, then churn in an ice cream maker until firm.

foods.name: Bibimbap
foods.description: Korean rice bowl topped with assorted vegetables, meat, and egg.
foods.instructions: Cook rice and divide into bowls. Sauté each vegetable (spinach, sprouts, carrots) separately with a bit of garlic and sesame oil. Cook the beef until done. Fry an egg sunny-side-up. Arrange veggies, beef, and egg on rice. Serve with gochujang sauce.

foods.name: Kimchi
foods.description: Korean fermented spicy napa cabbage.
foods.instructions: Cut cabbage and salt it to draw out water. Rinse and drain. Mix chili flakes, garlic, ginger, and fish sauce into a paste. Massage paste into cabbage leaves. Pack tightly into jars and let ferment at room temperature for a few days.

foods.name: Pho
foods.description: Vietnamese noodle soup with aromatic broth, beef, herbs, and rice noodles.
foods.instructions: Char ginger and onions, then simmer with beef bones and spices to make broth. Cook rice noodles separately. Assemble noodles in bowls, pour hot broth over them with thinly sliced beef, then top with bean sprouts, basil, and lime wedges.

foods.name: Banh Mi
foods.description: Vietnamese sandwich with pickled vegetables, cilantro, and grilled meat in a baguette.
foods.instructions: Toast a baguette. Spread mayonnaise inside. Layer slices of grilled meat with pickled carrots, daikon, fresh cilantro, and sliced chili inside the bread. Serve as a hearty sandwich.

foods.name: Gazpacho
foods.description: Cold Spanish tomato and vegetable soup, served chilled.
foods.instructions: Blend chopped tomatoes, cucumber, pepper, garlic, bread crumbs, olive oil, and vinegar until smooth. Chill the soup in the refrigerator. Serve cold with a drizzle of olive oil and diced vegetables on top.

foods.name: Feijoada
foods.description: Brazilian black bean stew with pork and beef.
foods.instructions: Soak black beans overnight. Cook beans with pieces of pork and beef in a pot. Sauté sausage with onion and garlic, then add to beans with bay leaf. Simmer until meat is tender and stew is thick. Serve with rice.

foods.name: Ceviche
foods.description: South American dish of raw fish cured in citrus juices.
foods.instructions: Cut raw fish into small pieces. Marinate in lime juice until fish turns opaque. Mix in finely chopped red onion, cilantro, chili, and salt. Serve chilled with tortilla chips or corn.

foods.name: Crepes
foods.description: Thin French pancakes served with sweet or savory fillings.
foods.instructions: Whisk flour, milk, eggs, melted butter, a pinch of salt, and sugar into a thin batter. Pour a small amount into a hot nonstick pan, swirling to coat thinly. Cook until edges crisp, flip briefly, then fill or top as desired.

foods.name: Croissant
foods.description: Flaky buttery French pastry, often eaten for breakfast.
foods.instructions: Prepare yeasted dough and layer with thin slices of butter, folding several times to create layers. Roll out dough, cut into triangles and roll into crescents. Let rise, then bake at 375°F until golden brown.

foods.name: Borscht
foods.description: Eastern European beet soup often served with sour cream.
foods.instructions: Simmer chopped beets in beef broth until tender. In a separate pot, sauté onion, carrot and garlic, then add shredded cabbage and broth. Combine with beets and simmer further. Season with vinegar. Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream.
